summary: Email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding a problem with defendant Nick (likely Nicholas Tartaglione) accessing his discovery materials while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). Barket reports that Nick has not been able to view his discovery since October 18th, and the AUSA states arrangements will be made for weekend viewing.

persons.name: Nick

events.title: Email exchange about discovery access problem
events.description: Defense attorney Bruce Barket emails an AUSA to report that Nick has not been permitted to view his discovery since October 18th, and the AUSA responds that arrangements will be made for weekend viewing.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defendant 'Nick' (likely Nicholas Tartaglione) was in custody and had his discovery materials taken from him on or before October 18, 2019.
Defense attorney Bruce Barket reported on October 31, 2019, that Nick had not been permitted to view his discovery since it was taken, constituting a 'roadblock' in the legal process.

An Assistant United States Attorney stated that arrangements had been made for Nick to view discovery in an attorney conference room the prior weekend and would be made again for the upcoming weekend.
The correspondence highlights potential issues with defendant access to legal materials while in pre-trial detention at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
